Class AsciiMutableString

extends Object
implements AsciiStringView, Recyclable

    • Method Detail

      • copyFrom

        public AsciiMutableString copyFrom(String value)
        Copies characters into this AsciiMutableString from the given String which is assumed to only contain ASCII characters. Should the given String contain non-ASCII characters, the result of invoking this operation is undefined.
        Parameters:
        value - the string to copy from
        Returns:
        this AsciiMutableString

      • copyFrom

        public AsciiMutableString copyFrom(byte[] bytes)
        Copies characters into this AsciiMutableString from the given byte array.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this AsciiMutableString

      • copyFrom

        public AsciiMutableString copyFrom(byte[] bytes,
                                   int offset,
                                   int length)
        Copies characters into this AsciiMutableString from the given byte array.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the bytes to copy from
        offset - the offset in the given byte array at which to start copying
        length - the number of bytes to copy
        Returns:
        this AsciiMutableString

      • copyFrom

        public AsciiMutableString copyFrom(AsciiStringView value)
        Copies characters into this AsciiMutableString from the given AsciiStringView.
        Parameters:
        value - the AsciiStringView to copy from
        Returns:
        this AsciiMutableString

      • copyFrom

        public AsciiMutableString copyFrom(StringView value)
        Copies characters into this AsciiMutableString from the given StringView, which is assumed to only contain ASCII characters. Should the given StringView contain non-ASCII characters, the result of invoking this operation is undefined.
        Parameters:
        value - the StringView to copy from
        Returns:
        this AsciiMutableString

      • wrap

        public AsciiMutableString wrap(ByteArrayView bytes)
        Wraps the bytes contained by the given ByteArrayView. This differs from the copyFrom(byte[]) method in that the underlying bytes are pointed to instead of being copied. Invoking any modifying method on this AsciiMutableString after invoking this method will therefore result in the modification of the given ByteArrayView's underlying byte array.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the ByteArrayView whose bytes should be wrapped
        Returns:
        this AsciiMutableString

      • recycle

        public void recycle()
        Description copied from interface: Recyclable
        Recycle the object.

        It is up to the concrete implementation to define precisely what being recycled means, however, the caller is entitled to assume that all internal state is cleared and that the object behaves in exactly the same way as it did on initial usage.

        Specified by:
        recycle in interface Recyclable
